title: Depressing Trip to the Gas Station

korean: 오늘 운전하다가 기름 경고등이 켜져서, 어쩔 수 없이 주유소에 들러야 했어.
요즘 기름값이 진짜 비싸다는 얘기 들었는데, 직접 보니까 더 충격이었어.
주유기 화면에 나오는 가격 보고 한숨이 절로 나왔어, 진짜.
그래도 어쩌겠어, 기름 넣어야지 차를 굴리지.
일단 가득 채우기로 하고 주유를 시작했어.
숫자가 막 올라가는데, 돈이 막 날아가는 느낌이더라고.
5만원 넘어가고, 7만원 넘어가고, 계속 올라가는데 진짜 속이 쓰렸어.
카드 긁으면서 이게 맞나 싶은 생각이 들었어, 솔직히.
예전엔 이렇게까지 안 비쌌는데, 요즘엔 주유하는 게 부담스러워.
차 없이 사는 친구들이 이럴 때 진짜 부러워지더라고.
그래도 차는 편하니까, 이것도 유지비라고 생각해야지 뭐.
english: So today while I was driving the low fuel warning light came on, so I had no choice but to stop at a gas station.
I've been hearing gas prices are really expensive these days, but seeing it in person was even more shocking.
When I saw the price on the pump screen I just sighed automatically, honestly.
But what can you do, you gotta put gas in to drive the car.
I decided to fill it up completely and started pumping.
The numbers kept going up and it literally felt like money was just flying away.
It passed 50,000 won, then 70,000 won, and kept climbing and I was really hurting inside.
Eventually when I filled it up it easily went over 100,000 won.
While swiping my card I was like, is this for real, honestly.
It wasn't this expensive before, but these days filling up feels like such a burden.
Times like this I really envy my friends who live without cars.
But cars are convenient so I guess I just have to think of it as maintenance costs.
